The fact that B peak does not diverge at θ = θ CR is attributed within this picture to the slight canting of the MoO 6 octahedra within the unit cell ϕ cant ~ 6°, as illustrated in fig. S8 (and section S3), which ensures that there is always a residual component of the B-field that is orthogonal to the quantization axis and, thus, the condition for perfect alignment is never satisfied. When the magnetic field is rotated within the ab or bc plane, the angle between the B-field and the quantization axis is always maximized when B// b, and so is the negative MR (

36 ). Thus, one expects the maxima (minima) to be located at B// a or B// c ( B// b), and no asymmetry in the ADMR is expected in these rotation planes (see section S5).
